title: [Rails] why use rails-i18n gem and localizations
content: [Rails] why use rails-i18n gem and localizations Ruby on Rails Saturday, June 2, 2018 I'm using the rails-i18n gem  and one of the locales I'm using is zh-TW If I take the gem out of my gemfile and rename the locale file to just zh.yml instead of it's previous name zh-TW.yml and change the first line from zh-TW: to zh: I can then use the short locale names in application.rb without the gem complaining the locale isn't valid? -- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Ruby on Rails: Talk" group. I'm using the rails-i18n gem  and one of the locales I'm using is zh-TW If I take the gem out of my gemfile and rename the locale file to just zh.yml instead of it's previous name zh-TW.yml and change the first line from zh-TW: to zh: I can then use the short locale names in application.rb without the gem complaining the locale isn't valid?
